security_audit.summary: This skill provides GitHub CLI command documentation. While the documentation itself is safe, it enables execution of gh commands that interact with GitHub's API and modify local repositories. Requires proper input sanitization to prevent command injection.

medium_findings.title: Command injection potential in API calls
medium_findings.description: The skill documentation shows API calls with variable substitution like 'gh api repos/{owner}/{repo}/pulls/{id}/comments'. If user inputs for owner, repo, or ID are not properly sanitized, this could allow command injection attacks.

low_findings.title: External command execution via gh CLI
low_findings.description: All commands reference the GitHub CLI tool which executes external processes and makes network calls to GitHub's API. This is expected behavior but should be noted for security awareness.

low_findings.title: Filesystem modification through PR checkout
low_findings.description: The 'gh pr checkout' command modifies the local filesystem by switching branches. This is normal Git behavior but represents a system change.

content.user_title: Automate GitHub workflows with CLI commands
content.value_statement: Managing GitHub repositories manually through the web interface is time-consuming and breaks your development flow. This skill enables seamless GitHub operations directly from your terminal using the gh CLI, automating PRs, issues, and workflows.
actual_capabilities: Create and manage pull requests with titles and descriptions
List and view issues with comment threads
Monitor CI/CD workflow runs and logs
Execute GitHub API calls for advanced operations
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) installed and authenticated
Only works with GitHub repositories (not GitLab or Bitbucket)
API rate limits apply to all operations

best_practices: Always check authentication status before operations with 'gh auth status'
Use HEREDOC syntax for multi-line PR descriptions to preserve formatting
Check for uncommitted changes with 'git status' before creating PRs
anti_patterns: Never hardcode repository names in scripts - use variables
Avoid creating PRs without descriptions - always provide context
Don't ignore CI failures - check workflow status before merging

faq.question: Is this compatible with GitHub Enterprise?
faq.answer: Yes, the gh CLI works with GitHub Enterprise when properly configured

faq.question: What are the rate limits?
faq.answer: GitHub API allows 5000 requests per hour for authenticated users

faq.question: Can I use this with other Git platforms?
faq.answer: No, this skill is GitHub-specific and won't work with GitLab or Bitbucket

faq.question: Is my authentication token safe?
faq.answer: The gh CLI securely stores tokens locally, never exposed in commands

faq.question: Why is my command failing?
faq.answer: Check authentication with 'gh auth status' and ensure repository access

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub web interface?
faq.answer: CLI is faster for bulk operations and integrates with your development workflow
